page.title: 10LIVINGSTON RAILWAY STATION
page.content: Residents of the{Murieston}area collected a 1000 signature petition to help gain approval for a railway station in{Murieston South, {Livingston.}People of the{Carmondean area thought that it would be better built in the north of Livingston. The go-ahead was given in 1979 to build the station in Murieston. Livingston Development Corporation gave Â£338,000 and the{European Development Fund}gave Â£71,000. The station was built ahead of schedule and was opened on 06.10.84 six months early. Between 200-250 people commute daily to{Edinburgh}and {Glasgow.}The trains run every hour. There are ramps to enable disabled people to use the station. Also at the station is a loud speaker system connected to Glasgow and Edinburgh stations.
